pull_request.title: Add support for Zephyr RTOS
pull_request.body:
Hi everybody,

This PR adds support for the [Zephyr RTOS](https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr), so liboqs can be used as a module (see [here](https://docs.zephyrproject.org/latest/develop/modules.html)). 

The main changes to the existing library code are focussed on the CMake build environment to enable the library to be built with the Zephyr SDK. All changes should not influence existing builds outside the Zephyr environment. (However, some changes also improve the integration of liboqs directly in a CMake-based project without installing it system-wide.) 

One bigger source code change is related to random number generation. Zephyr doesn't support any of the currently present RNG interfaces. To be most flexible, I added a generic `OQS_USE_EXTERNAL_RNG` option (disabled by default). In this case, an externally defined method `OQS_randombytes_external()` must be present during link time, which is then used to obtain random data. For Zephyr, I implemented that method to generate random data using their RNG interface. 

The main Zephyr integration is all contained in the new `zephyr` folder in the root directory (common practice for Zephyr modules to have this folder). In that directory, there is a custom `CMakeLists.txt` to integrate the existing CMake infrastructure into Zephyr. Furthermore, a Kconfig file is provided to configure the build (and especially the algorithm selection). Finally, the new `OQS_randombytes_external` method is implemented in a small C source file here. 

As this is my first PR for this project, I'm not sure if the changes are upstreamable in the current form. But I'm looking forward to your feedback.

Kind regards,
Tobi

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

comment.body:
With the current implementation, you are right. 

Currently, the implementation of the `OQS_randombytes_system` function is completely disabled when `OQS_EMBEDDED_BUILD` is enabled. Hence, we cannot switch “back” to the system implementation using `OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm`, as there is no implementation for it at all. 

As I saw it, currently  `OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm` is only used within the test applications in the `tests` directory (which don't use `OQS_EMBEDDED_BUILD'). But I may miss some other important places.

One solution I can think of is to store the function pointer provided by `OQS_randombytes_custom_algorithm` internally in a second variable and use that as the “new” system implementation. So, when the user changed the RNG algorithm using `OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm` and then changes it back to “system”, the method originally provided by `OQS_randombytes_custom_algorithm` is used again. This would make sure that `OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm` works as intended all the time. However, this would permanently override the default system implementation (until reboot). 

Another solution could be to add an empty implementation of `OQS_randombytes_system` in case of an enabled `OQS_EMBEDDED_BUILD` causing a runtime error stating that one has to call `OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm` providing a custom method. In this case, the user has to call `OQS_randombytes_custom_algorithm`  again after changing algorithms using `OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm`. 

What do you think about these possibilities? Or do you have an idea for another solution?
